nodes.title: Warp Mechanics Tree
nodes.excerpt: A walkable map of warp geometry, proxies, and control levers.
nodes.bodyMD:
Warp mechanics connect geometry choices to proxy constraints and operational controls.

Minimal artifact: warp knowledge docs (docs/knowledge/warp/*.md).

links.note: CL4 guardrail entry: constraint rho vs T00 reference.
Constraint gate is CL4 when inputs are geometry-derived.

nodes.summary: A walkable map of warp geometry, proxies, and control levers.

nodes.title: Warp Geometry Stack
nodes.excerpt: Geometry choices define the bubble shape and expansion behavior.
nodes.bodyMD:
Geometry anchors how metrics map to practical warp constraints.

Minimal artifact: metric definitions and geometry assumptions.

links.note: CL3_RhoDelta ties constraint rho to a T00 reference; CL4 requires geometry-derived T00.

nodes.summary: Geometry choices define the bubble shape and expansion behavior.

nodes.title: Warp Bubble
nodes.excerpt: Define the bubble geometry and boundary choices.
nodes.bodyMD:

links.note: Scalar gamma_VdB band is proxy-only until B(r) derivatives are modeled.

nodes.summary: Define the bubble geometry and boundary choices.

nodes.title: Alcubierre Metric
nodes.excerpt: Classic warp metric with expansion and contraction regions.
nodes.bodyMD:
Alcubierre metric defines a warp bubble with expansion/contraction (docs/knowledge/warp/alcubierre-metric.md).

Minimal artifact: metric form and assumptions.

links.note: Natario Example 1.8 reproduces Alcubierre metric with X^x = v_s f(r_s).
Natario Example 1.8 reproduces Alcubierre metric with X^x = v_s f(r_s).

VdB reduces to Alcubierre where B=1; region-conditional congruence.

nodes.summary: Classic warp metric with expansion and contraction regions.

blockedLinks.reason: Zero-expansion enforces div X=0; Alcubierre has nonzero expansion on wall (CL2 mismatch).

nodes.title: Natario Zero-Expansion
nodes.excerpt: Zero-expansion warp metric variants.
nodes.bodyMD:
Natario metrics focus on zero expansion scalars (docs/knowledge/warp/natario-zero-expansion.md).

Minimal artifact: zero-expansion condition summary.
nodes.summary: Zero-expansion warp metric variants.

blockedLinks.reason: Zero-expansion enforces div X=0; Alcubierre has nonzero expansion on wall (CL2 mismatch).
Natario class uses flat spatial slices; VdB uses B(r) conformal factor (CL0/CL1 mismatch).

nodes.title: Van Den Broeck Metric
nodes.excerpt: Warp metric with conformal factor B(r_s) and pocket region.
nodes.bodyMD:
Van Den Broeck metric introduces a conformal factor B(r_s) and a pocket region to reduce energy cost.

Minimal artifact: metric form and region definitions (see docs/warp-geometry-congruence-report.md).

links.note: VdB reduces to Alcubierre where B=1; region-conditional congruence.

nodes.title: VdB Region II Diagnostics
nodes.excerpt: Region II B(r) derivative diagnostics for VdB two-wall signature.
nodes.bodyMD:
Region II diagnostics sample B(r) transition derivatives (B', B'') and region-II stress-energy proxy from the pipeline.

Minimal artifact: VdB region II diagnostics in proof pack.

links.note: Region II diagnostics tie to B(r) derivatives.

nodes.summary: Region II B(r) derivative diagnostics for VdB two-wall signature.
assumptions: Region II diagnostics sample the B(r) transition with the pipeline polynomial profile.

nodes.title: VdB Region IV Diagnostics
nodes.excerpt: Region IV f-wall derivative diagnostics for VdB two-wall signature.
nodes.bodyMD:
Region IV diagnostics sample the Alcubierre top-hat derivative df/dr around R for the outer f-wall.

Minimal artifact: VdB region IV diagnostics in proof pack.

links.note: Region IV diagnostics tie to f-wall derivative df/dr.

nodes.summary: Region IV f-wall derivative diagnostics for VdB two-wall signature.
assumptions: Region IV diagnostics sample df/dr around R using the Alcubierre top-hat derivative.

nodes.title: VdB Two-Wall Signature
nodes.excerpt: Two-wall signature requires region II and region IV derivative support.
nodes.bodyMD:
Two-wall signature combines region II (B', B'') and region IV (df/dr) derivative support to confirm Van Den Broeck's dual-wall geometry.

Minimal artifact: vdb_two_wall_derivative_support proof.

links.note: Two-wall signature confirms region II + IV derivative support.

nodes.summary: Two-wall signature requires region II and region IV derivative support.
assumptions: Two-wall derivative signature requires both region II and region IV derivative support.
